review: Always friendly, always great, but....ALWAYS BUSY. Parking can suck, but being at the mall, you will find a spot.  Once I had the "Black & bleu" I was hooked. (Think that's spelled correctly) I havent had anything else since.

Went to their website for my first online order. Was that ever easy. I was able to sub items quickly. I applied my rewards card with no problem.  I like that at check out I was able to tip as well.  Pick up was at the bar, lucky I'm over 21. I had to wait about 3 minutes for my whole order. They gave a small cup of fries "for the ride home" that were fresh and hot.  Food was packaged well and they gave me plenty of napkins.

Hadn't been to a Red Robin since the days when it's food and wait staff were what you measured all other burger joints by... and boy has it changed.  I counted no less than 6-8 employees "sharing" duties at my table and NOBODY gave a damn or was responsible. I could have had a tastier cheeseburger at Sonic for a few bucks instead of  $13.00 and perhaps even known just who my server was! When I thought I'd seen "it all" a waiter (use that term lightly) sat down at the table with a family to take their order, and then whilst leaving in a huff notice who might have been my waiter sitting in a booth with a friend. Maybe if you don't remember what Red Robin once was it works for you, but as for me they'll NEVER see another dime from this guy.

Casual date night with my wife. We sat in the bar area to avoid a long table wait. We arrived a few minutes before the happy hour ended and were greeted by our waitress Kierstin. I was looking at the happy hour menu and was informed we had two minutes to order. I asked a few questions and got a catty, "Now you only have one minute ". If she was trying to be cute, the tone killed it. I ordered the Whiskey Jack Tavern burger and my wife had Mac and cheese with a Caesars salad. Burger was good but had two really thin patties rather than regular sized patties. If you want bottomless fries, order right away. We were finished with our entire meal before they arrived. We had ordered halfway through the meal. The waitress did check on us a few times but it was busy. Decent meal overall

I used to love Red Robin !! My favorite burger was the blue ribbon . I was excited to go to Red Robin After not going for like three years . Well I went the other day, and let me tell you It has changed . First of all, the waitress was rude , she Told us she couldn't explain a beer because it was new . Ok, so go get someone who can.  This chick has pink hair , which I know doesn't really apply to this, but If she sees this I want her to know to get a better attitude , she also gave me a 22 oz beer when I asked for a 16. She even wrote it down! When My burger came it didn't even taste like a blue ribbon burger. It Way too much sauce, and two little curds of blue cheese . Really? And the bun was stale. Came with like 6 fries that were soggy. The waitress we ended up having tho agree the rude one was very nice though .. Sorry redrobin I won't be back , your food has gone down hill and is nasty. Stocking  to my blazing onion! Way better!! Also you keep your bar freezing and uncomfortable ! Fix that.
I brought my son for drinks. Our server was amazing. She was so sweet. Our food was out in a flash.  Thank you Roxanne. You are fabulous.

I really enjoyed my visit at Red Robin in Silverdale today. It made up for the last visit that I had which is pretty awful. In fact it was so awful that they gave me a certificate to come back. I used it this time with no issues. Kirsten, the server, was really outstanding. She explained some new items on the menu, was very patient with me, and made sure that everything was in order make me happy for being here today after a long day at work.  I opted for a basic burger wrapped in lettuce. I I liked the presentation.  And, you didn't just get the burger in the lettuce, but they actually wrapped it in a foil wrap to undo as you ate. It made it not messy at all.  I had the freckled salad. That's a fruit salad with their freckled lemonade poured over it. It was a bit sweet but I liked it overall. Everybody knows Red Robin. We already have opinions about whether they're good or not. But if you like Red Robin and you come to Silverdale, and your server is Kirsten, I think it will be extra enjoyable.

We always have a positive experience when we go to Red Robin. The fact they give our children balloons and the chalk in the waiting lounge really show they are a family friendly place. I just want to speak about our last visit, where we had Napoleon waiting on us. He didn't even bat an eye to our table that had two small toddlers sitting at. He was so kind and patient that I will be requesting him upon every visit. This guy knows how to gauge his customers and wait on them accordingly.  Our food was great, and he was so nice to us when we asked for extras after he was JUST at our table. What a great employee for this company.

I've been eating here for as long as I can remember. Its probably my favorite place to eat near the kitsap mall. I have meet countless friends here for food and drinks. It definitely has gotten quite a bit nicer over the years. I would say it is currently one of the better looking Red Robins around but this could be because so many others seem to be in some sort of state of renovation. I love that this is a place you can bring children without having to be too concerned about their behavior. They seem to enjoy the coloring and kids menus as well. Be careful you don't let them play too long with the new table ziosks or you will be paying an additional 1.99$ with your meal.  This is one of my favorite places as you can get a pretty delicious vegan boca patty substituted on any burger. I also am a big fan of anything bottomless. I appreciate the move to healthier side options like broccoli and salad, but often still go for the fries. My non veg friends have many choices for food items as well. They seem to have really improved on the menu and now offer quite a bit more than just the burgers and fries they are known for. I also really love that they use a nutrition calculator on their website which gives you the freedom to play with different items on your burger if you have particular dietary requirements you are trying to meet. Refills are always frequent and service is typically fast. Its even quicker now that you no longer have to wait to pay your check, and splitting a bill is so easy.

Stopped in red robin in Silverdale tonight with my 3 kids and my waitress marina I think her name was. She was the best waitress I have ever had. I didn't need to ask her for anything, she was right there with refills and extra fries before I could even ask. My baby boy was getting fussy waiting for food and she came to the rescue with a little cup of oranges. Wish I had more the $20 for a tip. Wonderful waitress

If you've been to Red Robin, you know what to expect. At THIS particular RR, however, may you be so lucky as to get the server we did tonight.  I'm 47 years old, and Jenna has been the best server of my entire life. She was ... Perfect.  Brought bottomless refills before we asked for them, and anything else she saw we needed - or thought we MIGHT need.  (Which we did). Amazing server.  3 stars for the restaurant, 7 stars for Jenna.

On our Sunday date, we tried another restaurant first, but left because of poor service and ended up here. Our server, David immediately changed our moods around with his phenomenal service and personality. He was knowledgeable, and super helpful making suggestion for your newer menu items. Our food was delicious, and fast! The restaurant looks amazing, and everyone was friendly!! Thank you for having wonderful employees!!
Great place to celebrate birthdays! Good food, friendly staff and delicious alcohol. They have Ana amazing chicken salad and yummy blue cheese.

As a long time patron of Red Robin, And the daughter of one of the original crew members who opened up this location, I wish I could give them more stars, but it's just not possible.  The quality of food and customer service has gone down tremendously. The last two times I was there (apart from my most recent visit), I was given a bacon burger ... With NO bacon. Nota big deal, honestly - but when a manager comes over to talk to me about it and asks " Well what do you want me to do about it?" in a condescending manner I get annoyed.  My most recent visit was to celebrate my daughters birthday with family. I got bacon on my burger - yes! But my brother ordered their bleu cheese burger and received a burger with no bleu cheese. Fail once again Red Robin! I don't plan to visit again unless circumstances (and plans) are out of my control. The only reason they get 2 stars is because of the history of good service and food I've had in the past.

I am still leaving this as a 1 star since my last visit 2 years ago. Our hostess seemed annoyed she had to find a way to seat my 2 year old and my 2 month old. I asked for a booster for her that she never came back with. We waited for 10 minutes before we asked a waitress walking by if she was our waitress because we were ready to order drinks and no one had come up to serve us. It made the whole rest of the time very uncomfortable and we were very irritable before our food. You would think being a waitress you would want to give the best possible customer service for a tip, but I don't always get that here.

The wait staff is sooooooo rude and inattentive.  The food is exactly what you expect at Red Robin though so no bad things to say about that.  I just find that I am constantly waiting almost an hour to get my food.  I often will call and set up a reservation prior to arriving and I will be told that they will seat us in approximately 5 minutes or so.  Oftentimes that 5 minutes is more like 15-20 while I see them seat 5-6 groups before my small family, even with a reservation. Also whats the deal with the endless fries?!  They lowered how much are actually delivered, approximately half of what they used to deliver.  It takes so long to get your regular food, so how are you going to get extra fries?  I wish I could say better things but I really can't.

I received a no hassle email from someone, and they gave me a gift card which prompted a return visit. This time the food was to my liking, service was so so, nothing like it was the first time, (different server) my endless app was very slow. I never got a refill on my fries. but the burger was great, cooked nicely. It seems that it's hit or miss. the first trip the service was spectacular, but my food not so good. The second visit was good food and mediocre service. All in all I might go back again, but it will not be my first choice.
I've always had a good experience here... good atmosphere and great food... always had phenomenal service... been here numerous times... never disappointed.

My five star review is aimed specifically at the amazing service I received. Red Robin's food has always left a lot to be desired and this was my first time at this specific location, but my kids absolutely love the place so we will dine at them on occasion.    Our server Michelle went above and beyond to make sure we had the absolute perfect dining experience on our last visit.  Her big smile and positive demeanor really left an impression on my wife and I. She was very attentive without being overbearing, extremely knowledgeable about the menu and had my kids rolling with laughter through our whole meal.  This is the type of experience I hope for when I go spend my hard earned money and makes me want to come back again sooner than later. Keep up the good work!

The waitress was friendly and told me all of the specials. I ordered a mojito to drink and it had no sugar nor was there any mint crushed. It tasted nothing like a mojito. I informed my waitress and she let me exhange it for a beer.  Part of my burger was burnt but at that point I just needed something to eat.  Service was good but the quality of food and drinks needs work.
Great experience overall. Had a bacon cheeseburger and it was the best burger i've had in a while. Service was great also. Never had to ask for anything,

Honestly, I love Red Robin so much! Although it can be pricey, it's worth it for the endless fries. Last time I went in, the staff was way nicer and more attentive than I remember! (Thank you). I also ordered a vegetarian patty instead of the regular patty, and let me tell you, that vegetarian patty changed my life. It tastes so much better, and it's free of charge to change! One thing I did notice is that the honey mustard isn't as great as it used to be :( Other than that, this place is super good!

Only giving a 1 star because it wont let me give less. Been coming here for years and its worse everytime. Kitchen send out cold food and the wrong food. Manager is beyond incompetent. Host staff rude and cranky. Never nice. Dirty table right next to us(and dirty tables everywhere!) and it stayed dirty long enough for us to finish our food and put our dirty dishes on it since nobody would take any of it way for us. Drinks sat empty. Manager was NO help to his staff, and wasn't present durring the dinner rush. VERY disappointed.

Came in with my husband and two kids and service was fantastic! Food was delicious but the service from napoleon is the reason for my review....and he wasnt even our server! I dont remember the name of our server because his service was lacking and unmemorable but napoleon delivered our food, interacted with my kids and made our meal enjoyable! He even stopped back by to see how things were going and asked if we were ready for refills on our bottomless sides....i will be back for sure and i will specifically ask for napoleons section next time!

Overrated and Overpriced. Service is always lackluster. $15 for a burger in Kitsap County is just to expensive. Basic burgers covered in enough goop to disguise the very average burger. Red Robin is creative in having a great business model to turn a cheap burger patty into something desirable by putting enough sauces pineapple and additional crap to distract you from the fact you just paid way too much in Kitsap County for a burger with an egg on it. We tried going here after several years of avoiding the restaurant mainly due to poor service in the past. Service was mediocre at best, once your burger is dropped off they are done with you until they try to up sell the deserts. Same rating as Denny's hmmmm what does that tell you? Excellent if you want balloons for the kids,high chairs and a great place to let the kids scream.

I usually love Red Robin. It's one of my favorite places to eat. We recently moved back to this area and silverdale Red Robin is the only one in this area. After the last awful experience I said I wouldn't eat there again. Today is my birthday so my husband took me to lunch. He knows Red robin is normally a favorite and convinced me to give it another try. Maybe last time was a fluke. Wrong! We ordered appetizers, our meals and asked for a basket of fries (my meal came with fries), and the server said he was going to have to charge us extra for the fries. I've never ever had that happen when I already ordered a meal with fries. We went ahead and paid extra for more fries. We also asked for lots of ranch. He brought out one little container of watery ranch and the sorriest basket of fries I've ever seen. My husbands meal was brought out incorrect. The service and food were just blah. I wish I had gone somewhere else for my birthday lunch now. Two times in a row with bad service and mediocre/bad food. Now I'm really not going back.

I just wanted to commend the excellent customer service at this Red Robin location. We are visiting from CA and have dined here twice. The server named Napoleon was THEEE BEST! Very friendly, very attentive, and served our order ON POINT! I have never been so impressed with a server! Food was delicious and our family left full and happy!

So I have been there since the remodel and have been there with my family. I can definitely say that there has been a great improvement. I still wish they would remodel there restroom but hopefully it happens soon. The food and customer service has improved greatly and I'm a returning customer.

I never write reviews on restaurants, I dont know if you can see it anywhere but this is my first yelp review. Yep, my experience was bad enough that I signed up for yelp so I could hopefully save others from spending money on overpriced, thrown together food.  Took my wife and 2 kids since we knew they had remodeled we figured maybe the actual restaurant part had improved as well. We were seated quickly and thats where things went south. We waited about 10 minutes to see our server, at which time we ordered 4 waters and our food. We got a ranch/chips app, 3 burgers, and a kids pizza with a fruit cup side. 10 minutes later we got the chips, and my water was empty (keep this in mind). The chips themselves were fine, as was the dip, but there were about 3 other types of fried food bits with the chips as well as splattered oil all over the bottom of the plate. As a former fry cook in my highschool days, what this translates to is the fry cook went straight from basket to plate. After 10 minutes of eating our appetizer and an additional 10 minutes of waiting, we received our food, not from our server, but from another person. My crab cake burger consisted of the following: a crabcake, 4 spinach leaves, a squirt of sauce, and 3 sun dried tomatos stacked on top of each other (yes I counted because I couldnt believe I paid 15$ for this). The side of fries was 8 steak fries and more random fried food bits, again, yes I counted.  My wife's burger, which she ordered medium, was burnt and overcooked and the bottom bun was incredibly soggy from the bottom up, as though the plate was wet. She received about the same amount of fries I did. On the note of her fries, she paid an extra 1$ for the garlic fries, this consisted of about 1/4 teaspoon of parmesan cheese and non-existant garlic seasoning.  My daughter had the kid's pizza with a side of fruit salad, which came in a 2 oz plastic dipping cup ( this was a joke right? Like, haha we're kidding, here is some more!). She finished the fruit cup in 2 bites, the pizza she enjoyed.  My son's burger was the only thing that came out ok, he had a side salad with it and it was as expected. The person that brought our food was gone too quickly for me to request my water be refilled. Our server came to our table shortly after the food arrived and we ordered another order of fries for my wife and I, and another fruit side for my daughter. I also requested more water since mine had been empty over 25 minutes at this point.  We begin eating, and while the food didnt taste bad, I couldn't help but feel as though I was paying way too much money for what we were receiving, I mean the 2 burgers we (my wife and I) ordered were supposed to be Red Robins gourmet burgers, we paid 15$ each for these and I have received better looking burgers from Burger King.  About 15 minutes later, after we were nearly done, another person (who wasn't our server) delivered the fries. Once again they had other bits of fried food in them, mine had a couple of tortilla strips and a fried jalapeno slice and my wife's had a couple of jalapeno slices, what looked to be a fried mushroom and some bits of onion ring batter. They had forgotten my daughter's fruit cup, which since we had only seen our server twice at this point, we had to flag down another server to ask for. That came about 5 minutes later in an actual square ramekin, as it probably should have come in to begin with. At this point we just finished what we had on our plates, and since we had no hope of seeing our server in the near future, walked over to the server station to get a to go box for the fries. We used the little tablet thing, paid our bill and left. Remeber earlier when I said to keep in mind when my water was empty? It was still empty. This little visit, with terrible, non existent, service and thrown together food (seriously, the burger king near my house puts together burgers better and with more effort) cost me 60$. I will not be returning to Red Robin, nor will I recommend my friends or family to this restaurant.

Had a delicious California Chicken burger/sandwich the other night. It was a bit on the salty side. But I don't eat a lot of salty foods so I'm more sensitive than most. I had it on the wheat whole grain bun. Super yummy. I ordered with it the Freckled fruit. It was good but I think they use frozen strawberries. The mushy lifeless things were pretty inedible. But the other fruit was good. You know fresh berries or forget it. The service was great the waitress was very nice and a real Johnny on the spot. Before and during the renovations it was not very good. Now it is definitely on the list of places that I will gladly return.

I recently wrote a review of the things I was dissatisfied with at the restaurant. I would like to update. The manager read my review and apologized and then had a team member send me a gift card in hopes I will "give them another chance" that's is incredibly sweet and professional, I thought and completely makes up for my bad experience. Officially, Red Robin is no longer named "mud"  :)  Happy.

What would you know,  our waiter was making small talk upon his introduction, and when I mentioned I was a Texan gurl,  he informed me he once lived in Magnolia.  Don't know if that sparked such great attentiveness and service,  but Michael was awesome. Didn't have to want or wait for anything,  appetizers, drinks, refills, and food was delicious, hot and right on time. Before our drinks could get to the bottom,  we we're served, he had a great sense of humor,  and very talkative. If you are ever in the area, make sure you ask for Michael not to mention he's knows his job and way around the restaurant.

Went here for lunch today thinking it was going to be like any other usual Saturday busy experience at Red Robin.  Boy, were we wrong. Waited the usual 15 minutes to be seated which was no big deal.  Place was insanely busy which was no big deal.  Lisa, our server, checked in with us quickly to get our drink order which was fine.  Noticed the kids menu no longer offers coloring pages or crayons to keep kids occupied, which is the first negative.  But that was just the start. Ordered a rather simple food for lunch.  Butter and cheese pasta for my daughter, a cup of the French Onion soup, the Turkey BLTA sandwich with fries and the Whiskey River BBQ Burger.  Not rocket science here. 45 minutes later.....soup arrives in a square bowl the size of maybe 2" x 2" and maybe 2" deep with soup that was ICE COLD AND ROCK HARD.  But here's the kicker....no other food?!  Sit waiting and waiting and waiting another 15 minutes.  Ask about our food and was told very rudely by Lisa that it would be out when it was ready and the food runners would know when it was ready.  Ummmm ok? When our food comes out 20 minutes later, fries are ice cold, and kids pasta is CRUNCHY AND ICE COLD.  I mean seriously, how hard is it to boil pasta and throw some butter and cheese on this? When we called Rick, the manager, over, he was quick to point out he knew what the issues were and seemed to know this was an ongoing issue.  Ok, so if you know these are ongoing issues, why not fix them????  The table right across from is was rather ticked off too which was pretty funny too. It will definitely be a cold day in you know what before we return to this place.  Hopefully other people will have better experiences than we did.  What a shame how downhill this restaurant has gone......

The food was good but the service needs some work. It seems as if the staff is to reliant on the digital screen on the table to the point you never see your waiter any more. Go a little above and beyond people.

Second time here and I really enjoy it.  Good food.  Bottomless fries.  A great kids menu.  Plenty of burger options.   Plus, fantastic sweet potato fries.  Will probably make this part of the regular rotation.  Highly recommend.

We used to love ordering take out here. Lately, they have been getting our orders wrong and being skimpy with the food. I don't  like that we have to pay full price for a meal and not receive the same service as if we were dining in. Last night order was wrong, food was cold, and didnt taste the same as it normally does. The manager was quick to fix everything, but it is a hassle to drive back and forth for the correct meal.

This place was packed last night! There were so many birthdays that I lost track when they sang their birthday song for the 10th time... we were one of them.  The service was good considering there was about 20 of us. The server checked up on us often.  I ate off of my friend's onion ring tower. It was super good as always. I ordered a salted caramel milkshake and fish/chips. I wasn't impressed with the flavor of the milkshake or my fish.  This location is a little far out for me so not sure if I'll be back.
i went dinner time they are so kind and good service and food is awesome  place is cozy ~~~ i had a great time though

While my husband and I have been going here for a long time, this is the first review I have written.   My husband ordered the Big Tavern which was delicious.   I ordered the fish and chips which were quite good but there was skin and scales on a couple of pieces of fish.  Also , they put the fish on top of the fries which soaked up all the grease.  Next time I will get the fish on a separate plate.  They also are not having the Seahawks Tuesday this year.  Boo

This place has really taken a dive over the years. Tables, chairs and bathroom were disgusting. Even the menus were gross. I'm no germ freak but damn! Makes me wonder what the kitchen looks like if they keep the area where customers actually see/eat.  Waiter looked like he was on meth and my friend pointed out a waiter that had manipulated his "tip" section of his receipt twice, reported it and yet the dude is still working there??? Why haven't they fired him yet for theft? I won't be coming back to this Red Robin anymore.  My advice... Don't come here and if you do, pay with cash!

Love the remodel job that they did.  I think it cuts down on the noise level in the restaurant.  I tried the new whiskey river Rio chicken salad.  Tasty.  Love the avocado on there. My boys had burgers which are always good.   Waitress was very personable and friendly.   Thanks for a yummy dinner Red Robin.

I like their gluten free burgers.  We try to time our visit for a time we can find a booth where it is a bit quieter by the bar.  Unfortunately, since their remodel, the booths are scarce.  The tables in the center of the area are uncomfortable and too close together, so we often leave after scoping it out and go over to another restaurant.

Great service as always. Nice to come back for a visit after almost 8 months and servers still know us. Accommodated our large group with ease and speed and dealt with our horrible jokes with grace. Y'all are awesome

Wonderful dinner with my daughter tonight. The restaurant was jumping packed...so we sat in the bar. I ordered the hamburger with bacon and a fried egg...I forget it's name. I had the bacon put on the side and added avocado, and onion straws on the side. Christi ordered the teriyaki chicken burger with garlic fries. Both of our meals were perfect.  Service was spot on, chow was perfect...price was agreeable.

For years I swore off this chain, but recently gave them a try. I'm so glad I did! The new menu and improved quality of food, exceptional customer service, and a much quieter dining experience impressed me. The prices however are ridiculous. For a family of four, $70 for burgers makes this place a less than regular stop.

Alright this is just ridiculous. My wife and I come in  all the time and order 1 burger to share and a root beer float to share. This time however our waitress informed us they were no longer allowed to cut our burger in half. Which is a little ridiculous I have literally never been to a place much less red Robin that would not cut my burger in half. It's basically standard at red Robin so I have no idea why it changed. But no my wife and I have to try and cut it our selves which you know isn't that hard but we for sure lose the aesthetics of the burger when we cut it our self.  OK so that was strike 1 Strike 2 was when we asked for a refill on our root beer float. And the waitress asked if we were sharing. When we said yes she refused to refill it. So let me get this straight if I am by myself I can order 10 if I wanted to and it would be fine and be the price of 1.  but if I want 2 to share between my wife and I cant. That is a really stupid policy and a policy I have never heard about until today and I have been coming here for YEARS.  Strike 3 is right after that she asked if we wanted more fries. So we can share bottomless fries but not a bottomless drink. ugh This visit just pissed me off

Roxanne is the most unprofessional bartender I've ever met. Just disgusting and rude. Not a fun environment, pure chaos and they pack you in like cattle. Even if the food is good, the staff and layout is horrible and not worth the overpriced drinks and the five fries they give you a couple times.

Okay Red Robin, you have redeemed yourself.  Maybe it was the experienced waiter, maybe the kitchen staff was on point, but my food was delicious, everything was warm, and came out at a good pace.  I will be back and I want the experience I had tonight to be the experience I always have every time.  We are on good terms RR.

I couldn't like a location less. This has got to be the WORST Red Robin ever. We've (my husband and I) have gone three times. The first time we went we waited and waited. It was mid day on a Wednesday. Less then half of the tables were full. It took over 40 minutes to get a burger. Endless fries my a$$ the ones they brought were cold and grease laden. We ordered a second batch, and they came to the table after we paid. We got refills once on drinks. I just had water. Never got the extra napkins, or the ranch sauce we asked for. The waitress stopped by once. The other times we flagged down someone else, it was the waiter for the tables nearby. The bathroom smelled like putrid garbage. It was very dirty. Second visit. Busy as all get out. We waited, my husband wanted burgers. They sat us at a table. We were literally on top of the next table. They couldn't get out unless we moved.  We ordered a small app. The chips with ranch. We placed our order about 5 minutes later for our food. We got our drinks after about 20 minutes. After sitting there for 50 minutes we got our food, about 3 minutes later we got the ranch and chips. ARE YOU EFFING kidding me? No apology, no nothing she sat them down so fast the ranch spilled over, and she just turned around and went to talk to another table. My husband got the BBQ burger with a pineapple slice. There was so much BBQ on the burger he had to remove it with a spoon. We saw the waitress once after that. I was just a bad time. We had the wedges that night I believe, and they were the highlight. Okay so the final time. We had a 15 minutes wait. Maybe 20-30 people there. My guess is they didn't have enough staff. They sat us alone against that wall when you walk in. My husband ordered a burger again. I tried something new. I got the French dip. My husband ordered a long island. He was so grossed out by it. It tasted exactly like watered down lemonade and cheap gin. We ordered the chips with ranch again, because it's just the right size. This time we got it before our food, but it still took 20 minutes. Also they gave us about 10 chips. So we didn't even eat it. At this point I'm getting into a argument with my husband. The issue, "Why do we keep coming back here? They ignore us, the food sucks, and the wait for everything is ridiculous." When we finally get our food. His burger was char, and his fries were cold. I got sweet potatoes fries. They were old and tasted like they were dropped into grease for a second time. I could have rung them out. The au jus for my beef was Disgusting. It tasted like beef drippings mixed with a box of salt. The sandwich was exceptionally small. To be fare I'm from Chicago, a beef is three times as big, smothered in peppers and cheese, and dripping with au jus that taste like heaven. On a fresh French bread, with a golden crispy crust. This was gross. Again the service was so bad. Also there is a young woman (African American) or so I think. She is a hostess. Three of the waitresses had a nasty conversation about her. That my husband and I heard every word of. Save yourself the trouble. We tried out the Brewery across the parking lot. Same prices for burgers, small options but better meat, burger, taste, quality. Someone told me they were pricy. However we spend 15 on a burger at Red Robin, and the same at the Brewery, and they also have great service and bottomless fries.

My parents (particularly my mother) swears by this place and visits quite frequently.  I have gone with them a couple of times, but never felt feeling as satisfied as my mother always seems to be.     There is absolutely nothing wrong with the service from what I've experienced...in fact, I distinctly remember finding the waiter quite pleasant and friendly.  The atmosphere is just fine as well, and I'm pretty sure the restaurant was fairly clean in general. But what I found to be disagreeable was the menu, and lack of food options.  Everything seems so greasy and...I don't know, bland and crusty.  I'm not a food/cooking connoisseur, so I can't adequately express what I found unpleasant about the meals I've had there...they just did not taste good.  It just doesn't seem like the kind of food you generally expect at sit in restaurant or to pay more than $7/meal for.

I'd like to say that Red Robin is the Best Burger around but it just doesn't stand out that way at times. I've just had a lot of Hit & Miss experiences at this Red Robin.  I do like the bottomless fries, although when you get your burger it already seems to not have that big of a helping of fries so ya kind of run out before you even get through with your burger..... Maybe if they gave ya more from the start you wouldn't need the "Bottomless".   Some of the burgers are very tasty, while some that say they are (The D.G.B) are not.  Seems like they have a great Logo and Image but there food just seems to be to "Corporate" for lack of a better description.
I've always good food and good service at the Silverdale location.

My kids always beg to come here when we are in Silverdale, but for the third time in a row the service stunk. We walked in at 5:45 and surprisingly were sat right away, and our order taken right away. (But it is Wednesday and not a weekend.) However our food took 30 minutes which is unreasonable for a half empty restaurant and almost unbearable with small children. When it finally did come, our check back was 1 minute later before I'd even taken a bite of my too pink for me hamburger. I waited about 10 minutes before eating but no one came back and I was hungry so I just ate it. Our drinks sat empty almost the entire meal, my daughter's never did get refilled. I realize this is "casual dining," but it seems they've gotten a little too casual on the service as well.

I have had bad experiences at Red Robin in the past, but this place was the worst. We had a toddler in our party, and this is why Red Robin was chosen, due to it usually being pretty kid friendly. It took 20 minutes to get drinks and when we ordered the server advised us that they were out of broccoli. Um, how does a restaurant run out of broccoli that it offers as a "bottomless" option on their menu? It then took 35 minutes to get our food. Our server came by once and when I asked for a refill, I never received any one. We never saw the server again. This wound up being a 2 hour experience, which is a long time for a 3 year old. Your service is terrible Red Robin, your restroom is awful and you need to buy more broccoli.

This place seems to be great at times and awful at others depending what person is that month. I did really like coming here at one point in time but the service is so inconsistent. The food quality seems to be just as inconsistent as the service, at times great and at others just bad. I once got served a salad that had 67 hairs in it that I pulled out and counted (one was 6 inches long). I guess the chef thought that I was missing protein in my diet or something? 3 stars because the building stays clean, the bar staff is generally descent, and hostesses seem to get you seated quickly the minute a table comes available.

That's it!! After begging this restaurant staff for a hamburger that is above room temperature for 2 years, I quit. We did actually get hot food there the last few time we were there but get this: I specifically ask our wait person to be sure my hamburger is served hot and she started laughing. I asked why and she said because we get that request so often!  I said "I'm serious" and she said "ok." Sure enough it turns out she was laughing because they do not serve hot food upon request but just would not tell me that. So, we are going to the new burger joint or Applebee's from now on.

Recently moved to town and its our first time trying Red Robin. We had such a great experience, our server was fantastic and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered the boneless wings with blue cheese crumble. We also had the beserker burger and chicken salad. Everything came out quick and tasted great. I would definitely come back and try something else on their vast menu.

I'm writing this from the restaurant... Steffan is an amazing server! Like seriously y'all aren't paying him enough, whatever it is! This is our first time back since the remodel and they have it looking amazing, and they brought back their old garlic herbed fries! 10/10 we will return again :)
Got drinks a minute after we ordered and got our food 20 minutes faster than the Buffalo Wild Wings across the parking lot. Food was served beautifully as well.

Sad to say we used to love coming here. This location is newly remodeled, I liked the old setup. The quality and portions of the food have gone way down. I already said this before, that I would never come here again, but with the remodel I said lets give it a try. This resturant is on its way out in my opionion. Sad I remember when the managers used to come to your table to make sure everything was good. I never see a manager anymore. Red Robin if you are listening, go back in time 15 to 30 years ago that when you had it right.

Horrible!!! I don't know what it is about Red Robin but is seems to suck no matter which one you go to.  Bad service, cold food, and a lot of stuff messed up always! Oh well, no more Red Robin for me!!! Blah!

Unhappy with this location. Have been here 4 times and have been disappointed. Red Robin has always been a big part of my family and friends and I would visit their Renton and Lynnwood locations EXTREMELY often, so I know how the food should taste. First time I went here I got dark brown slices of avocado on my sandwich that were completely unappetizing and had clearly been sitting around for a long time. Then when asked for a replacement was told there was going to be an additional charge! Doesn't taste right ever. Love the company, not this location.

Pricey but great service!  No bun, no cheese, no sauce, no problem. My recent diet change is really restrictive but I was still craving a burger last week so I called them for a to-go order and they were very accommodating.

I'll admit, RR used to be the "Go-to" place in town. It disappoints me to say that it no longer is. Prices have gone up, and quality has gone down. My most recent experience was for a relative's birthday. There were six of us, so they sat us at a table in the middle of the main dining area. It took probably 15 minutes to get an order in after we were seated. Like felt bad for our server, as he looked pretty overwhelmed.  It took probably another half hour for our food, and by that time, we were starving.  When it finally arrived, our server couldn't even properly serve us. The tables were so close together, our tiny server couldn't get through to set plates. It was literally "take one and pass it down." Pretty sure I wasn't getting paid to serve food. Along with you burger, you get a half dozen fries, because they're "bottomless."  That is, if your overworked server actually has time to bring more. If he does, let's hope you're close to the people at your table, because you'll be sharing their "bottomless" fries. I'm willing to cut the server and kitchen some slack, as it was pretty busy, but that seating arrangement. No one wants to be right on top of the table next to them. If I go back, it'll have to be on someone else's invite. Such a shame.

We have been to this location several times since moving to Kitsap county two years ago. To be quite honest, they should be glad that I never wrote a review in the beginning.  I worked at Red Robin after high school for a short time in Southcenter, my brother worked for the corporation for almost 10 years and at multiple locations, and the restaurant is a family favorite. My family and friends have celebrated countless birthdays at different Red Robin restaurants... While we have had imperfect experiences over the years, we have relatively high expectations because we know the company aims to satisfy high expectations. They seem to have a good team these days in Silverdale. My favorite server, hands down, is named Cody. We try to sit in his section whenever possible, and he seems to work a lot since we have been at many different times of day and he's nearly always there. Cody is friendly, extremely knowledgeable about the menu and options available, and attentive to no end. The matter how busy he is, he takes time to stop at your table and let you know what's going on with your order. I would say the one thing that they still need to work on is the hosting staff... They're not very warm and they often appear frustrated or frazzled. The last several times I've been there, you see them off to the side talking in hushed voices... I can't hear if they're talking about themselves, their coworkers, or the customers, but regardless it makes us feel awkward.

Have our sons 11th birthday party there on a packed Friday night! We came with a party of 20! Only had to wait 30 minutes for a table! The staff was amazing food was on point. Not one glass went empty. I have never truly had a bad experience at this Red Robin. They go up and beyond good customer service and really decent food!

Rude, terrible service not only at this location but even when explaining my problem to corporate and they didn't even apologize. Maybe tell your customers when you're having an egg shortage and when something is going to be replaced on a menu? Seems like pretty common sense to me.

The upside: bottomless steak fries (that really are the best any restaurant has ever made) and convenient.  The downside: poor service. We have tried time and time again and it's just never been "good." The last visit, December 2015, it was our oldest sons' 13th birthday. It's our tradition for the person celebrated to choose their dinner spot and he chose Red Robin. We alerted the waiter it was his birthday. Not only did they forget HIS burger (when all our food came out well ahead of his, by ~10 minutes), no one sang, the burger wasn't free (and we reminded the server a second time of his birthday), we wanted dessert but were rushed out and opted to go elsewhere for a treat.  I realize one persons' business isn't terribly important but it was certainly a downer on our kids' special day.
Terrible service by the server we had and the two managers we made a complaint with. This place is going downhill, we will NEVER return to this establishment.

Nearly 45 minutes waiting, for food! Service was non existent, food quality terrible. Never coming back. This used to be the best place in Kitsap County, it has now been completely passed up by others!

I love red robin and crave a good banzai burger from time to time. But after living in this town for 26 years, this location has really gone down hill. The last few times my husband and I have gone there, our burgers have been burnt or the food not cooked properly. It has happened time and time again so we have just stopped going.
BURNING LOVE !!!  Love this Burger with a Flare, Jalapeno was nice and warm lol makes you sweat in this cold weather.
Food was great and our visit was pleasant. The milkshake was awesome but the fruffle truffle dessert things were a little on the disappointing side.

When the food is hot and cooked correctly it's a solid four star predictable, the service at this location is negative two stars pretty much every time, giving this location two stars. The food is pretty standard.  If you've been to Red Robin you know what to expect from the food.  If you haven't been to Red Robin, don't make this one your first experience. The service here is LOUSY, and as far as I can tell has been for years (we used to come to this location when we lived here before 5 years ago and nothing seems to have changed).   We've been in three times since we moved back (in the last few months) and the service is always slow (we know this and we NEVER come here when we are in any kind of hurry).  The last time we were in was the worst though.  First, we were not acknowledged at all when we came in, I had to walk up to the two girls "hosting" and wait while they finished their (not work related) conversation before they acknowledged I was there and took my name for the wait list (wait for a table was not too long).  They have changed the kids menus (they are now much like the regular menus and are not coloring pages, so there is nothing to entertain kids while you wait   for your food), our server did rustle up some old menu/coloring pages for our kids, but I don't know how long that will last.  Knowing this place is slow we always try to be ready to order the first time we see our server, so we placed our food order with our drink order.  Our drinks came relatively promptly (but were never refilled and two of us were just drinking water).  Our food took a long time (over 30 minutes), and when it came it was cold.  My chicken wrap was completely cold (the chicken should at least be warm) and it was dry (almost no BBQ sauce and almost no cheese) and my fries were cold.  My children's food was cold, COLD.  My husband's burger was cold AND overcooked and his fries were cold as well.  Also, they have changed the garlic parm fries which used to have real pieces of garlic, real shredded parm, and real parsley, they now have  some flavoring that comes out of a can, no real garlic flavor/pieces, no shredded parm, and no parsley, certainly NOT worth the extra $1 you pay for them (so, just don't).  Twice I made eye contact with the manager as he walked by but neither time did he ask how we were doing.  The server didn't even really stop to see how things were...it just feels like no one there cares if you have a good experience or if you ever return. We really like Red Robin's food (when it is cooked right and served hot) but this location is just bad, which is too bad because there aren't a ton of predictable food places in the area.   There are some non-chain options in the area, not as predictable with their food, but the service always seems better.  Like they care if they have and keep your business.

I really love burgers. The Bleu Ribbon was always my favorite. But this time - as the last few - it has not been what it was. Consistently the "crispy onions" have been a soggy mess. They aren't inedible, but they should be like that in an $11 burger.  Life is about change... Sadly RR doesn't seem to be changing for the better.  The service was good, if harried, and responsive to my requests. Food came out quickly. Staff was adequately friendly.

Very disappointing dinner tonight. We always order our burgers "as pink as you can make it". Most of the time, we're not disappointed. Tonight the wait was over excessive, my burger was well done, we asked for additional fries & didn't receive them until we had already finished our burgers, and we never were offered refills on our drinks. Red Robin is always a favorite...and, we will return...but hopefully we'll have better service next time around AND a better burger!!

I have been going here to eat regularly for a long time. I have never had a disappointing experience until today. Went in today with a group of friends. Waited for over a 1/2 hour to get seated. Once we got seated, it took a long time for the waiter to take our orders. Once he did, it was a an almost hour wait until we got our food. We asked if we could get fries until our food got there and were told that they cannot do that anymore, it's a "Red Robin" standard. When we asked how much longer our food was, we were told "I don't know." Our waiter did not check on us this whole time. It used to be a good place to go, but after today, I doubt I will be back. Service was horrible.

My granddaughter & I had lunch at this Red Robin today.  It took awhile for our order to be taken because our server was really busy.  Our food arrived and our burgers were really good.  My sweet potato fries were cold.  Our waitress checked on us and brought me some new hot fries.  So, I took the time to give her a good review on the video checkout.     While I was doing this, my 19 yr. old granddaughter went outside to have a cigarette while I paid the bill.  She calls me from the parking lot and tells me the cops pulled up and were accusing her of trying to steal a car or stuff out of a car.  You've got to be kidding was my reaction!!  I drive a non descript dark gray Kia Optima....there was the same style dark gray car parked one car away from mine with a white car in between.  She accidently went and stood next to the other dark gray car and smoked her cigarette. Then she went back into the restaurant to use the restroom while she was still waiting for me.  She went back out and realized she had been standing by the wrong dark gray car and found my dark gray KIA and stood next to it while she waited for me.  The man that owned the gray car one space away from mine, was watching all this from the restaurant and he got everyone convinced that my granddaughter was trying to steal cars or items from cars and then the Sheriff was called.  She had just had lunch at Red Robin with her grandmother!!      After the call from my granddaughter, I walked out to see two patrol cars and a Deputy standing with my granddaughter.  After hearing the accusations, I told the officer that the other gray car looked almost identical to mine and anyone could have made that mistake.  The 2nd officer came out of the restaurant and was very set on the fact that she was trying to steal something based on the overreaction of a customer(s).  That is the farthest thing from the truth!!!  She was merely waiting for me to finish my lunch and pay the bill. The older of two Deputies told my granddaughter that the manager has now band her from the Silverdale Red Robin and she will be arrested for trespassing if she ever returns.  I find this an extreme reaction to a simple misunderstanding.  Myself or my granddaughter never had a chance to speak with the manager before this decision was made.  My granddaughter is not a thief.  She is an excellent student with a clean record.  The Manager definitely should have handled this situation differently.  All he/she had to do was to ask my granddaughter if she was waiting for someone in the restaurant??? and all this could have been avoided....she was not loitering...she had just had lunch at Red Robin with her grandmother and was just waiting for me and having a cigarette. She is a typical 19 year old young lady and she was probably checking out her hair and makeup in the car window reflections, not casing the car(s).  Total misunderstanding fueled by a paranoid customer and handled poorly by management.  My granddaughter was humiliated and left with me, 'in tears' .....

Last 2 times we went extremely bad service and cold food. Actually the last time our food never came (after 25min) we asked for our check. Our server stated "gosh, I'm like the worst server ever!" Then made us pay for our drinks. Sad because we used to love this place, but won't be back, and can't recommend it to anyone else though.

Tried the smokey angus burger and it was not bad, Two stars for the food. My only complaint is it wasn't very hot. The bacon and the bun were actually cold. This happens often here and clearly the management does not care. And get rid of those table top ziosks, you corporate hacks. The third star is for service, pretty good.

Wow what a disapointment. Server was obviously new. He forgot silver, refils on drinks. Food arrived COLD. We asked someone i think it was manager for a refil and it never appeared. It was my birthday and we had company in from out if town. Teally really disapointed..

I've been to a host of these around the country and unfortunately this is the worst one.  Our server was wonderful but the service was slow, our meat was not cooked to order (I think the other locations use fresh beef, not frozen) and the condition of the restroom was quite poor.  If you've been to other RR's around the country you will be disappointed. If this is your first time, you'll be impressed with the choices but know that it could be much better.

It seems like they're using some processed patty now. Flavor was ok but they no longer seem so "gourmet". I was pretty disappointed. No utensils for 20 min. Waited a long time for refills defeating the concept of bottomless. Napkins came only after a minor spill and way after our appetizer was finished. Paying at a kiosk for my parents in their 60's was difficult. No kids activity (placemats with crayons). No coasters, and at one point, we had 7 empty glasses and 7 full glasses, an empty onion ring tower, and 5 empty plates crowding our table . The waitress had 5-6 tables at once. I think it was a little much. I've seen this location do much better in the past.
This place... This place. The light flickered, the food was left sitting on a counter somewhere to get cold, the lettuce was wilted, the gluten free bun was pretty bad too.

i just ate here and had a terrible experience. Absolutely the worst service i have ever recieved at a restraunt. Had a group of 6 servers hanging around, few were standing literally right behind my chair the entire time. They loudly complained about quote "stupid people who eat here" and gossiped about work. i asked my waiter multiple times for things and still did not receive them as requested, he wasnt busy as there was only one or two other tables in his section. As far as food goes, it was alright, my wifes food was under cooked and my sons fruit salad was questionable with non edible previously frozen mush strawberries and was seriously skimped on the famous bottomless fries i had asked for more for myself and wife and was eyed by the server. Then the server was of course, extremely prompt and confrontational, after seeing we left no gratuity. He approached us with arms crossed clearly upset asked if their was a problem and how the food was, but im sure he knew the answer to both of those questions. We were going to write it off til approached like that. No reply he returned to co workers who mentioned during their conversation they "only talk about customers, after they leave." Staff has some serious attitude problems, Smh at this staff and its service today. Last time i ever eat here.

We ordered our food and appetizer with a quickness.. 5 .. 10.. 15... 25 minutes later still no food or appetizer .. Spoke to the manager and was assured our food was coming up.. 40 minutes worth of ice tea and sugar packs our food came out before our appetizer .. I've had a bad experience here before but gave it a second chance .. NEVER AGAIN..I give it 2 stars because the football game was on and that's being generous !!
They are really slow with horrible service, waitress forgot and messed up quite a few things. The food was alright but it wasn't worth the long wait to get seated and the long dreadful service.
Was not a good experience. I do not recommend the Silverdale red robin.

Your typical Red Robin,  nothing special, but not bad. The service was better than I usually get at other Red Robins'; the food is pretty much the same and that's a good sign. They are good for groups and a good place to go if you don't want to make dinner.

I have been going to Red Robin for years and I agree with most everyone on here.  Prices have gone up and quality has dropped dramatically.  Our family of four dropped by on Sunday and were seated after a couple minutes.  Our server was attentive and kind BUT it all goes downhill from there. We submitted our order and it arrives relatively timely.  The server forgets my salad.  Okay, no worries...they are busy I get it. My husband bites into his $10 burger that he asked for medium rare and it was well done.  Oh well...he keeps it.  Then we realize my daughters never got their shakes and they arrive AFTER they have finished their food!!!  That's the final straw...I ask to talk to the manager. The Manager shows up and I rave about the service but then show him my husbands burger and how its WRONG.  How I didn't get my salad till halfway through my meal and that my kids shakes came at the end of their meal so they didn't hardly touch them.  The manager apologizes profusely and offers my husband another burger...uh...he ate it why would he want another one?  Then do we want to take some mud pie home?  No, we are full. Mr. Manager, that is when you COMP part of the meal because your restaurant screwed up repeatedly.  But nope.. Just more apologies and nothing. Red Robin used to be the go to place for burgers...the last few times I've been there it has really tanked.  I will look for a new place to go.

We had our sons birthday party there. The waitress was really attentive and the food was really good. She even brought tons of napkins (knowing how messy kids can get) without us asking. They sang happy birthday to our son and gave him a free ice cream for his birthday. It seemed hard for them to accommodate our group of 15 people.

Today was not a great day for the Red Robin and it's a sad and disappointing day for me. The Mai Tai was awesome but that was it it. I order the burger with over easy egg and bacon it was came with fries that weren't cook or should I say fried all the way. The burger no true favor. Red Robin proudness it's self in the worlds greatest gourmet burger maker. But today they did not live up to there name I going home to put the horrible experience out of my mind and maybe order a pizza. Can't miss that up right.
Found glass in my beer. Told the bartender and he was apologetic and offered free beer.
The ticket time is alittle long but it's worth it for the product they produce. I get the whiskey river BBQ chicken wrap nothing to tough but it always come out so nice and awesome looking.

I took my family out to dinner here, they messed up our oder, over charged us, and to top it all off, i got sick, my food was undercooked our  appetizer bbq boneless chicken was tough and over cooked. I am upset, and i will not be going back to this location. And just so im clear, i wasnt sick when we all sat down to eat.

Went to this Red Robin yesterday for the first time in a decade or so (moved back to the area recently). I've had Red Robin in Seattle, and in Chesapeake, VA. I can say that both the WA locations I went to were above and beyond what I experienced in VA. Food was awesome. Prices are a little high, as they are at most restaurants here in Kitsap (which caught me off guard having lived in southern California for the past 3 years), but the quality and attention to detail was on point here in Silverdale. At 6pm on a Sunday we were the only ones in the bar area and were seated with no wait. We'll be back, but I think I'll wait until I find a coupon.

We love Red Robin food and what we love even more is our waiter Napoleon. We get him a lot and usually we have a massive party and every time he is upbeat, positive and well worth the tips. Keep this guy around because he is about 20 people's favorite waiter

I visit this location often and most of the time they are great, but the last 2 times I have been to this location is has been bad. The most recent being yesterday when we took our 2 daughters to the restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. Our server Napoleon was fantastic, as always but when we ordered nachos we were eating them and found a long hair in them which totally grossed us out, but we understand it happens. The part that was disappointing was we were told that we would not be charged for the nachos, which would have been great if we would have gotten a replacement. Instead, we just didn't get charged for nachos we couldn't eat because there was someone else's hair on them. .. no replacement and no apology from management. To me that was not good customer service. We should have been compensated our nachos free of charge and got a new order and maybe some other type of compensation for the whole grossness factor. It was just bad customer service in my opinion, and I feel this locations kitchen issues and management will make me think twice about taking my family there again anytime soon.

This Red Robin is always packed on a Friday or Saturday night and well that's when the service is best. Went with my wife mid week and had some of the worst service. We asked for mustard and almost 20 minutes later of no mustard and our waitress disappearing I went to the back kitchen line and got mustard. The same waitress took my card and again disappeared for another 15 minutes. The manager came to our table and didn't really seam to care about our issues... Not really sure if we'll be back here or not

This red robin has great service. The entire wait staff, Bartenders, even hosts are really friendly. My burger came perfectly cooked, and my Margarita was excellent. Show up for happy hour for really cheap appetizers and drinks!

As usual this place was busy. I don't think I've ever visited a Red Robins that wasn't busy and I've been to quite a few locations in different states and at different times of the day and yet they are always packed. On the other hand, there's a good reason for that. They have really good burgers and fries. I've never had a bad experience food-wise except for the time I got the fish and chips which wasn't all that good. I recommend sticking to the burgers, it's what they're good at. I recently tried their crab cake burger; I know it sounds a bit odd, but it was delicious. Just one fair warning!  Apparently this is the place where everyone goes for their birthday. You will hear their version of the happy birthday song about every ten minutes. The last, I'd say ten times, my husband and I have been to a Red Robins, different locations, this was our experience.

I'm done with the Silverdale Red Robin. It stinks in the restaurant. It is so run down and dirty. I used to always bring my kids to Red Robin for their birthdays, but not anymore. We used to have so much fun, but I do not enjoy the experience at all anymore because it is so run down. Until it is remodeled and refurbished I will not be back. P-U. Stinky! Very disappointed. It used to be a fun place. The rest rooms are gross. Just go in and look how dirty the carpet and fixtures are. Gross!
Lackluster service. "Bottomless" fries served five at a time. The fish in the fish and chips was quite good though and I always enjoy the freckled lemonade.

I am giving them 1 star, hopefully to get their attention to resolve the RAW meat situation we experienced on Saturday.  It's just not okay to serve barely cooked hamburger, but particularly when the waiter explicitly asked whether we wanted to "see pink or no pink" when we ordered.  As if this wasn't enough of a problem, the fries were spongy and cold, and the service was terrible.  We asked for replacement fries but they were not delivered to our table until we were ready to leave.   WHAT IS GOING ON AT RR???  We've always liked RR burgers as a treat, not regularly but sometimes when we are in Silverdale.  They have a great gluten free bun option too, so this is a place we've enjoyed.  But this experience placed the Silverdale location of RR in question in our minds.  We did explain the problem to the manager and he comped our meal and apologized, but we feel that the problem is far too serious to leave it at that.  This location needs to seriously take a look at quality control for the health and safety of its customers.

If I could I wouldn't give it any stars! But the site requires that you give one star and that's it! The food was horrible! for $11 hamburger, I got a piece of crap and cold french fries! The hostess was very rude, I was there on Friday October 9th and the hostess was so rude! She goes after I asked her to order some food to go she says "that's not my job go to the bartender" so I go into the bartender and had to order through him, he was not pleasant at all! was mad because I didn't order a drink well I wasn't going to stay and I wasn't going to drink! When I got back to my hotel room, totally disappointed I will never eat at another Red Robin ever! so if you think about going there or go someplace else! I total got ripped off!
AMY helped us celebrate my b-day burger today. What a wonderful worker/server you have there. We've been enjoying your burgers for many years. People like AMY keep us coming back Carl Bornhouser

So I am not a fan of their steak fries, at all. In fact, I try to avoid this place and I'm usually pretty good at doing that.  Anyway, my family had a get-together here for some special occasion so I decided to drag myself along. Their gourmet burgers are good, I never have a problem with that but I just cannot stand their steak fries. So when I saw that they offered Sweet Potato fries as a substitution, I literally heard angels singing as light broke through the clouds! haha..  I ordered the Pub Burger with a little pink in the middle. This burger has ale-braised onions and mushrooms, creamy peppercorn-ranch, melted Cheddar and Swiss cheese, and fresh tomatoes served on a toasty onion bun. Um yes, DELICIOUS. Okay so it didn't have a little pink in the middle, whatevs. The burger was still pretty moist so I'm OK with that!  The sweet potato fries were great! Well, they were great up until I got to the bottom of the tray and saw that they were swimming in a lot of oil. Pretty unappetizing... but the fries were still YUMMY! lol... I'm sure I can get past that by dodging the fries that were soggy beyond rescue from the oil they were sitting in.  We always get the Onion Tower to start because really, who doesn't love deep fried onion rings dipped in Red Robin sauce? If I wasn't so turned off by their fries, I'd totally go there more often. But oh well!  Staff is friendly, atmosphere is great for children and adults alike. Decor reminds me of a hoarder trying to make random pieces "mesh well" on the wall. All in all, a good place to go for a family-friendly meal! Great burgers and awesome fries (not the steak ones for me please, haha).

The plates we got were covered in chocolate so the waitress had to give us new ones. It took them a bit for them to get our appetizer out and it ended up coming out with the burgers. Overall the food was okay but for the price I would have expected a bit more.
Been here multiple times, never had a problem. The hosts and servers are attentive and really nice. Be back again!

Ok, so you can usually tell when you get the waiter or waitress that is new because of their inability to let you ask for something before they zip out of existence - or spill a drink - or make an excuse about how long the bottomless fries will take - and all of this in perhaps the first 10 minutes after being seated. What I dont get is why you wait for a table for 10-15 minutes, and then you sit down, only to have to wait another 10 minutes for horrible service. The thing is, I realize it's NOT fast food - so when I'm paying an average of 12 dollars for a burger and 3-5 dollars a drink, I do expect good service, and that's just the things on the menu. Am I right? So it's been 23 minutes an we've gotten fries, only to have devoured the measly baby portion in 2 min. Serious, how can they boast bottom less, when they come out of the gate saying "it's a dinner crowd and excuse excuse excuse!" I'm like, ok...hire a new cook team and bring in reserves, you should know by now, people like your food, and I as many am sacrificing service and wait time for that delicious campfire sauuuuce smothered on just about anything. Ok, ten minutes later and a second drink refill is finally here, but a server zipped away before I could ask for sugar. 101 for tips, always ask- "is there anything else I can get you?" ....I at this point am feeling bad and ask for more sugar. Duh, the table has none and you're bringing me tea. I robbed the table behind me (exhausted from getting up), and now the kids who ordered the 5 dollar root beer floats are being told the ice cream machine is "running slow". So- the food comes, still no shake for the wife- 30 min later and still no refills for kids. Sad. I don't know if I feel more sorry my family who are patiently full of sad face and disappointment or my fellow red robin employees who simply don't care. I even took a picture of my sons colossus burger...the sadness in his eyes cries why me father? What did I do to deserve this? For the love of god! And even the bun was wrong (they ran out of white). Wait! All drinks have arrived, my wife has almost finished her meal. The sadness in her eyes is compounded by unexplainable tears. The great red robin would be clucking in his grave knowing the disservice bestowed upon us. What they lack in service they make up for in food quality....but you'll wait. And you may have to ask 4 times for your shake, from several employees. Note to Red Robin, forget the birthday clapping and work on customers. Hint, the birthday people don't tip. At this point the salt and sugar has kicked in and almost all is forgotten on a weak attempt at service, now we wait for the check. A whopping $60 later, and I feel like I could have gotten the same thing from Micky Dees for 1/4 the price and 1/4 the time. But I'll probably come back next year while I crave the campfire Saaaaauce!

Really hit or miss when I go in. I always get the clucks and fries. Was really pissed the last time I went. My chicken strips were completely raw in the middle! Of course I eat as much fries as I can while I am there so I took them home without knowing. I called and spoke to the manager and he talked to the griller. Nothing else though. So much for good customer service.

I came here with my family and some friends on Aug 15th. I had been craving a good mushroom burger and Red Robbin's usually is on point. I can honestly say this was the worst dining out experience I've ever had!!  First we waited 35 minutes to be seated (expected to wait, no biggie) than once we were seated we waited over an hour for our food. When our food came out my daughters didn't, and only half of her friends did (9 & 10 year old hungry kids) I ordered chicken on a stick for my 10 month old and his chicken was raw, still pink in the middle!! All 3 the burgers us adults (one pregnant) had ordered were also on the raw side, we complained and explained how we had ordered them (2 "little" pink 1 no pink) we than waited 20 minutes for our order to be corrected... when it came back all were "super well done" like burnt hockey pucks!! So we have not waited 2 hours for nasty food that was uneatable... We honestly should have just walked out with out paying, but didn't. We paid and left starving!! I will never return. Who serves raw food to an infant and a pregnant woman? Here's a tip... Cook your food properly the first time, and you won't get behind having to fix orders. Also the bathrooms were NASTY!! only one stall had toilet paper, no paper towels, and a few stalls didn't lock. When we told the hostess she just rolled her eyes at me and said "yeah! I know" Well excuse me for letting you know.. I know there was a 20 minute gap from when my daughter and her friend went in and informed us, than I went in and found it in the same condition... if she knew than someone should have done something about it. Not just be rude to the customer for letting them know about the unsanitary conditions.

This is hands down the worse Red Robin I have been to... Waited over an hour from the time my order was taken until we received our food.  Burgers were sloppy and small. Honestly Dairy Queen could have made a better burger.  Not worth the extra ordinary wait small pittance of fries and expense.... Stay away unless you like to be frustrated and than angered as you wait and wait and wait... Worst Red Robin
Take out. Fast and easy. You even get your own parking spot :) we asked for extra fries and we got them!!! They also didn't skimp on ranch or any other sauce. Will be back :)

I used to like Red Robin...OK, that was like 20 years ago when things didn't seem to bother me as much.  So where do I begin... - This place is loud. Tin ceilings throughout...Really? Ceilings are supposed to absorb sound, not reflect it.  The three intoxicated teen-adults at the bar were heard by all.  The only saving grace was that they occasionally drowneded out the two screaming babies we had to listen to...while in the bar. - I only ordered two items, hot wings (clucks or something) and a salad, both with ranch dressing.  The wings used to be better; these were just winglets...no drumsticks, and the red sauce was oily and nasty.  The salad, when I eventually received it (yes, I had to ask for it after the hot wings had arrived), had wilted lettuce and the dressing was blue cheese. - The draft beer was only moderately cold, not 32 degrees like some places these days. Overall, this may be the last time I go to Red Robin...at least, this Red Robin.  I would consider going back, but only after they changed their food, upgraded their taps, hired a better staff, and totally demolished the building and rebuilt it so the bar doesn't sound like a freaking daycare center.

The server was horrible and didn't pay any attention to us. Remember the bottomless fry selling point? The fry container that came with the burger held 7 fries. I asked for more and it took 15 minutes. I had already finished my burger. Won't be going back to any Red Robin anywhere.

The burgers are good.. not great but good. Last time we went the fries didnt seem cooked long enough. We waited awhile for food as well but our server was nice. We ordered the hummus plate for an appetizer, it was horrible. All they did was cut a cucumber in half, add baby carrots and hummus and called it an appetizer. If i wanted food my 3 year old could make i would eat at home... it was not gourmet. Would have been better if it was more of a variety of beggies that were actually sliced, maybe some cheese and lettuce... anything besides 2 huge pieces of cucumber

THE WORST RESTAURANT EVER!!! i would rather go to mcdonalds then eat here again, i ordered a cheese burger WELLLLLLL DONE when i got my food i took two bites of the burger and knew it had a weird texture well once i ripped the burger apart  i noticed it was bright pink and still cold raw meat no thanks, i refused to let them give me another they ruined my apatite, now the bottomless fries i never seen them either until we were ready to leave, the service was extremely poor i would never go back and would not recommend this place to anyone,,,( they still charged me for the raw food i didnt eat)  i wish i could give negative stars
This red Robin has really gone down hill. Fries are always cold, service is never that good. No matter how many times I say NO TOMATO NO ONION I still get it....time to look for a new burger place.

Normally love the food but this visit we were seated at a dirty table in the back next to the serving station (even though there were a lot if open tables) and then the server disappeared. The table was greasy and sticky and pretty much ruined it for me.  They finally wiped it off right before we got our food. When I got the burger it was pink in the middle even though I asked for it with no pink at all. Not planning on returning to this one again. Might try the one in Seattle if I really crave Red Robin again.

This location is in deperate need of a makeover. As i drove up it looks like the kitchen had a fire recently, is that legal? As you walk in something does not smell inviting? We sat in the bar the game was on seats were worn out and the walls were desperate need of paint, no dry wall too. Headed to the bathroom GROSS... thats all i got. Server was nice and attientive but looked like she just crawled out of bed. Received our burgers. 12 dollar burgers...well disappointed to say the least i could a better burger at jack-in-the-box. For cheaper. Fries were the best part...when I could get ahold of someone to order more.
Their burgers are great and the staff is very friendly.  I recommend to try the Whiskey River BBQ Burger, The Sauteed Shroom Burger, and the Towering Onion Rings.

We love the Silverdale Red Robin. Compared to others around Puget Sound, ours is always "on top of their game". Not sure about all these recent reviews, because the last few times we've been here (twice this month already) the service and quality have been as good as ever. It starts with the greeting staff - always courteous, fast, and efficient. You should have seen them on Veteran's Day - packed because of the Vet special + the Seahawk Red Zone deal on same night!  Yet, they were incredibly effective in getting everyone a table in a reasonable time while keeping a smile on their faces. A special shout-out for our favorite server - Cassy.  She rocks!  Always on the go and never forgets to bring anything. She is top-notch. The other servers we've had here have also been consistently good. Other Red Robins and other restaurants - hit and miss. Our extra condiment "asks" usually require a second request.  Never need to at the Silverdale restaurant!

This place is like a circus with a bunch of kids running around,  very noisy, and dirty dishes. How do I ever begin about this place? From the wait staff to the food, this place is plain horrible!!! It has Applebee's prices for McDonald's service. Seems as though all of Washington crazies come here. I had to leave immediately. Just wow!

I used to love this place. The last two times I have been the service has not been good and neither has the food. I really hope they turn it around soon but I will not being going back for a long time.

Compared to prior visits, very disappointing. The remodel is incomplete, and the room temperature was chilly. Lobby and dining area dirty, and no efforts by staff to sweep or clean. We arrived around 8pm and there were plenty of staff, and many empty tables. Was seated right away, but waited a few minutes before the order was taken.
