Then it took a long long time to receive the order. My son started playing the game console, but the server never told us we would be automatically charged 1.99 entertainment fee. I used to enjoy eating here, but I think this visit cancels any future prospect of returning.

From yummm to bummmmmm.  Grand daughters Bday,  very slow service, seated at 7pm food arrived at 8:15.  All orders arrived Cold, manager replaced all orders with slightly warmer food in 5 min.  Offered to give dessert on house but after waiting another 20 min to order dessert we had had enough of this brand of misery.  Left at 8:50 pm no Bday song.  Most of the staff seem shell shocked, no one having a good time.  When I talked with manager in way out he apologized but was insincere.  Red Robin used to be a great burger experience, well prepared tasty burgers.  Now it's all pre cooked and the cooks merely assemble the food to standard picture.  When the last time you had a bacon quacamole burger that had no bacon taste?

We normally order to go, same bacon blue cheese burger with fries, and we always get a nice load of fries with that house sauce they make, pretty good.. I enjoy the fries more then the burger at times. Our last order was non-the-less the same, this time our orders almost 15 dollars each, came with a total of 24 fries in varied sizes, in two orders, one had 11 the other 13, I called and asked about it. Explaining to the duty night manager that we normally get a ton of fries sometimes an extra box with just fries in it. He told me that was wrong, a normal order had 8 to 10 fries, and basically I should feel lucky that I got that in the past, I explained that I paid close to 15 dollars an order for a burger and unlimited fries,  and asked if 8 to 10 fries cuts it? he explained that's the way it is, so I explained that for 15 dollars for a burger and 8 to 10 fries doesn't cut it... and I won't eat there again. that's just to much to spend for a burger and endless fries that I don't get.
Came in at noon when it wasn't busy and waited 40 minutes for a burger. Wouldn't have been bad if the burger actually tasted good :(

We probably just had our last Red Robin experience, too.  That's $30 and 1.5 hours of my time I'll never get back! I had an inclining that things wouldn't go well when we sat in the bar and no-one said so much as hi to us for 15 minutes.  We should have left then.  The service was abysmal, and the food was mediocre.  We were "served" (if that's what you dare call it) by Charles, who took a long time to greet us, a long time to take our order, never brought silverware or napkins, and didn't bring our food (which came cold and soggy) for 50 minutes.  I guess he probably had some alcohol he was serving elsewhere with expectations of higher tips.   My husband ordered a chicken wrap with a cup of chili.  The wrap had no visible chicken, and was quite small and overwhelmed with mediocre bbq sauce.  He says they must've been scraping the bottom of the chili can to come up with the three tablespoons of bad chili that came in his cup. I ordered a mushroom burger.  It came cold and soggy, and when I looked inside I found canned mushrooms.  I asked the guy who brought the food (not Charles) if they used canned mushrooms, and he adamantly denied having any canned food at the restaurant, but immediately brought out a cup (fuller than my husband's chili) of cooked mushrooms that were fresh, not canned.  The burger was tasteless, grey, and cold, the bun was mushy from sitting in (I have to assume) canned mushroom goo on the plate for who knows how long, the Swiss cheese was either non-existent or flavorless.  I made the mistake of paying for bacon, which was also pretty flavorless. We were stunned by too much Christmas shopping and made the mistake of eating the meal and paying for it.  Twenty minutes later the heartburn started. No more Red Robin for us!  We live in a place where we joke about the mediocre service and food, but Red Robin of Silverdale has the worst restaurant where we live beat for mediocrity.
GROSS GROSS GROSS.  Your glory days are over, herr Robin.  You have gone the way of Red Lobster/Olive Garden.

Ordered late take out...bruschetta chicken burger and whiskey river burger.  I usually cut my burger in half and luckily I did because my chicken was completely raw and pink.  This is poor service and disgustingly poor management. And to think that this restaurant is geared towards family dining with kids. If my raw chicken burger were to end up on a kids plate...that would be terrifying!  The restaurant was closed and I couldn't call to complain...so my rant on Yelp will have to do.  I will not be back...and encourage others that eat here to cut into there burger before eating to avoid getting salmonella poisoning.   Gross Red Robin Gross!
Why is Red Robin still in business? Commercialized "gourmet" burgers, blah! I liked this place 15 years ago when I was in high school.  Go to Silver City.

I was disappointed with our red rob in experience last night.  It was my daughters birthday and we hadn't dined there for quite some time ( 6-9 mos).  We observed many changes.  No pre fries unless you paid the pricy extra charge. Ok we get our meals and we were surprised with the new serving size of the kids mac n cheese meal.  The macaroni and cheese was served in a small square dish.  You would be lucky to get 6 bites...not too mention the fries on our plates were minimal maybe 6 per plate. Chinzy.  Then when we requested more fries we had to wait.  By the time we got them our burgers had already been eaten.  Not impressed.  Then we noticed the sundae for my daughter didnt even include a cherry on top.  Not to mention the new balloons on a stick, with no helium.  Just a stick large enough for a kid to poke someone's eye out!  I must say i miss the old red robin where you were sure to have a good dining experience.  Sorry red robin you are no longer one of my picks for a good dining experience. Their generosity went out the window and if you are bringing a child they will still be hungry after their meal.

Been coming here for the last 18 years. Never really had a problem. In the past six months I've been three times. The first one, my burger, that I asked for well done, was raw in the middle. The second time was okay. Just very slow service. Tonight? Tonight was the kicker. Will not be coming back. I ordered the buzz clucks and Mac and cheese. They forgot the Mac and cheese. After it took way too long to get. Then when I did get the Mac and cheese, it wasn't very warm. And there was supposed to be four cheeses. I only saw and tasted to cheddar melted on top. The waitress said she was getting the manager. Almost 15 minutes later, he finally showed up. Took the meal off the bill. That's nice, but I'm still hungry. So, yeah. I didn't mind the stomach aches from the burgers when my kids were young. But now that we're all adults, why bother with Red Robin. Silver City is better.

I have been to Red Robin's all over the place and this review is specific about this location. I was there with 5 other people and we sat in the bar. The waitress just was not on her game that night. Appetizers were delivered with no napkins, plates or silverware. One of our party got up and walked over to get napkins. It just seemed when we needed her, she was never around. The food was great as usual.

Pretty sure I just had my last red robin experience. Let me start out by saying our waitress was really nice...the food on the other hand was not good. My daughter didn't get her side with her meal until we were about to leave, we reminded them about it when her meal was dropped off. The meat on the burgers was NOT good, I think the changed their supplier...maybe? The "fried" egg on my burger was NOT fried. As soon as I cut into my burger the yolk went everywhere and made a mess. We were not offered a refill on our "bottomless" fries till we were all done eating and starting to clean up our table. A pretty bad experience...gonna have to find a new place to meet my hamburger cravings.

The food is just your average, chain restaurant food. Stick with the burgers, sandwiches and salads and you'll be good to go. I really like that you can have any burger lettuce wrapped. I will say this place always seems busy but we have always received decent to good service. And the other reviewers are right. Bottomless fries paired with their campfire sauce will turn any sour day around.

I don't come to Red a Robin very often but each visit has been pretty decent. I came here last night and ordered the BBQ Chicken Burger which tasted really yummy until I noticed the chicken was a little pink just two bites in. I usually don't send back food but it was making me a little sick to think about so we politely told our waitress and asked if I could just order the BLTA (can't go wrong there) and in less than 5 minutes, the manager brought out my new sandwich and apologized. It was delicious. I love, love the fries and the bottomless Rapsberry Limeade. The food isn't anything spectacular but it's tastey and well priced. I like it here.

Really disappointed. Waited more than an hour for our food and drink refills were hard to come by. The kids were nearly out of their minds by the time the food arrived and my chicken patty was basically pink inside leaving me with just the 8 fries that came with my sandwich to eat. Normally I would have sent it back but with a non existent server and the already long wait it was pointless.

great burger selection. Great menu. They hosted a Make A Wish family/Wish Child  send off party and they COMP'd the entire bill. When a business does that for a good cause they deserve kuddos. Our server Cassy was awesome too.
I love their never-ending fries! I went on a busy day and I was not disappointed with the service our table was given! We had a party of 6 and we were served quick and friendly.

We've been here twice. Both times our server was prompt and polite, and our food came in a timely matter. My burgers both times, although I ask for well-done, came a little charred. Not terribly so; still edible. I mean, it's a burger. I do recommend the berry limeade. That stuff was tasty, and the cup was fun.

Today, our server was Katie.  My husband and I come to Red Robin quite often. We enjoy their freckled lemonade, and milkshakes. My husband likes their root beer floats, too. Today I got the Bacon burger with Cheddar, no mayo or tomato, add pickles instead. When I got my burger is was nice and hot, had a good amount of lettuce, the cheese looked nice and melted and there were plenty of pickles which really makes me happy! The fries were a little cold, but we were too hungry to even care. We ordered some of their Mozzarella sticks and got them within 15 minutes. They were alright, I've definitely had better. They were also a little cold. My husband got the A.1 Peppercorn and he really likes it. He said it was juicy and filling. My burger was a little tasteless, even adding the red robin seasoning didn't do much. But, again I was too hungry to really care, or even notice. Our waitress came to check on us about 2 or 3 times, just brought extra napkins (my husband is a messy eater). She just brought us drinks when she seen we were getting low. I really enjoyed our time here. The food could've been more hot, and better tasting... But hey I don't expect much from a chain restaurant. Our last experience was awful though! (different waitress) They lost our order and we were there for 2 hours. They kept bringing us fries to keep us from starving to death, but never gave us any discounts for the trouble or anything free. Our meals had fries already so I'm kind of wishing they would've offered something else with our meals (we ate our weight in fries, lol)  Today's experience was a different story though, we had a good time. No long waits, the waitress was fast, friendly, and helpful. She got a well deserved tip. My advice to Red Robin, is to stop spending so much money creating a new menu every few months and spend your money making your tasteless food have it's great taste back. Your food has changed since we first starting going here (years ago). I would be a regular if it wasn't for that.

I've ate at a few different Red Robins and this is about the same as all others, just ok.  Service was ok, food was ok, price is a little high for the quality of food.  No recommendations from the menu as all their burgers are about same.

Tried the Beserker Burger...DRY is the best way to describe it...couldn't taste the Aoili sauce...however the wife went out on a limb &  tried the Blue Ribbon Burger...blue cheese crumbles & onion straws...she loved it & that's saying a lot because she rarely ventures off of her usual...finally gave up on the Strawberry Lemonade as well...the strawberries always get caught in my straw.

Usually stop into our local Red Robin after school orchrestra concerts.  This time Red Robin was off a bit.  I ordered what I always order, Banzai Burger, it came out with bbq sauce and fried onions on the burger, oh and pineapple was there, so you had to look real close.  I returned it being I really didnt crave bbq sauce mostly didnt want fried onions on my burger.  They happily ordered a new banzai burger and gave fries to hold me over....meanwhile everyone one else ate thier meals.  Surprisingly, the new burger came out quick and was delicious!  So I was happy with Red Robin!  will go back !
James was our server last night and his recommendations were PERFECT! He was very attentive and wasn't pushy. The service was way better than the last few times we have been in.

I can always count on this place for consistency at least for me and my wife.   We always start off with the onion rings for appetizers and a couple of burgers for the main course. I've never really tried any of the other stuff on the menu but I'm willing to try if I see recommendations from other Yelpers.  The burgers are ok but maybe its because I get them well-done. Maybe I should try with a little pink next time. I'm sure the burgers will be more moist but increase my risk of illness. Then again, I do like my steaks medium. Hmmm... Oh, I added an extra star for friendly staff and those endless fries. Mmm.

Red Robin at one time was a great place to go. But for some reason the last few times I have been it was awful. Service was very poor and so was the food. Sorry RR I gave you many chances and now I will never be back. Other places in Silverdale and better quality.

Great fast service. I remember coming to their Southcenter location for high school dances and call it nostalgia- but I really enjoy coming here.  Breakdown for Stars:  Service: 1 Star  Depending on the day and the time you come service is somewhat spotty, but overall the servers are pleasant.  Quality of Food: 1 Star  Sorry- but who can resist their bottomless fries? Their children's menu has a great variety of items, and although their food can be bland at times, if you're lucky you can get a pretty tasty burger.  However, do not expect a mouthwatering, explosion in your mouth good tasting food. Atmosphere: 1 Star  I really like taking my kids here- why? because they aren't the loudest ones in the restaurant, and as I stated above- nostalgia- reminds me of high school dances, "parking lot pimpin", and it didn't break the bank.  This isn't my go to restaurant, it's my 3 or 4 times a year kind of joint.

Don't go there on Tuesday unless you want to wait an hour to get a table. Seahawks score a TD in the red zone, and it's free Tavern Double Cheeseburger day. Well, they did. We went there on Veterans Day Tuesday. The line was into the parking lot for the free burger and "bottomless" steak fries. We sat in the bar area because we would have had to make a reservation in the lobby. No problem. We found a booth. They had just opened. Couldn't really tell who our server was. There were about six, standing near the flatware station arguing which person had which tables. As it turned out we were delivered a menu from one server, our order was taken by another, our food was delivered by another, and we had to ask another to take the order for more fries. Our burgers came pretty fast. Problem was there were only 8 fries on my plate, and 12 on my wife's. Ya, we counted them. Couldn't believe they were so tight with the fries. C'mon Red Robin. This is what you do. Put more fries on the plate. Burgers were good. My wife had the Banzai and I had the Tavern Double.  Hers had a little too much grease on the bottom bun, but otherwise she enjoyed it. We were done with the burgers and first fries about 10 minutes before a server popped up close enough to us to take an order for more fries. We weren't allowed to order them up front, or we would have. So, Red Robin, we like your burgers. Fix the fry situation. Fix the server situation. We'll likely be back, but there are other choices we want to explore. It was good, just not good enough to get us back sooner.

I gotta be honest, I love this place.  Regardless of any foodie, cred loss, I am not ashamed to admit it. The burgers here are pretty freaking tasty and the price for them is extremely reasonable.  Also, they have the largest selection of vegetarian options for this type of restaurant as any of their burgers can be made with Boca (my choice) or Gardenburger (the lady's).  So, this usually makes it my go to dining place in Kitsap. And lets not forget about bottom-less fries.  Sometimes they can come out kinda s****y, but when they are fresh out of the fryer, it's awesome.  And this is the only place that I don't gag from eating ranch.  I don't know what it is about places around here, but it seems like they all mix old ranch with new when restocking and it gives the ranch a slight to extreme sour taste.  Red Robin seems to keep their's stocked properly. Drink prices are typical for the area; high.  Thats the only real low point.  That and the noise.  I typically sit in the bar so I don't have to deal with people bulls**t kids running around my f*****g table, staring at me while I eat.  But this is the only place I've really experienced that kind of thing.  Sit in bar, problem fixed.
Atmosphere is bad it way too LOUD.  Slow service and too expensive for what it is.  2 burgers w/coke and tip was almost $30.

I said before this place was mediocre. I apologize to all the mediocre places I insulted by comparing them to this Red Robin.  Ate there yesterday. Service, poor. The family at the table next to us gave up and left without ever seeing a server. Mind you, this was mid afternoon, not crowded.  We got nachos. Far and away the worst nachos I have ever seen. Not fit to be eaten by humans (although they did use fresh jalapenos, not jarred. That was cool). Daughter ordered 'queso' dip. It appeared to be velveeta with chunks of burger patty in it. Seriously. Something an eight year old would make you for father's day, and you would slyly dump in the trash.  And the server constantly bugged us about signing up for some rewards card. When we finally agreed, some computer glitch made it take over ten minutes. We left the reward card on the table, because we won't be back.  One star because zero is not an option.  PS - the beer list sucked.

This is the first time I had been to a Red Robin in 8 years and this first time I had been to this particular one. It was just as I remembered it. Very crowded and noisy. The prices were a little high. The selection for burgers was very good and the bottomless fries were nice but the service was slow. Only when I was ready to leave did the second portion of french fries show up. The parking is the mall parking so no problem there. It is not a bad place to go, but I know of quieter place to have a meal. I don't have any plans to return anytime soon.
I always eat in the bar as this place can get a little noisy. The service is great and quick. Great burgers and drinks too!

Yea buddy! Ate there for lunch today and dad gum them burgers is good. Onion rings are not flimsey, but hearty and crunchy. Waitress was good and attentive and the atmosphere was inviting for a group of guys to have a well deserved lunch. Thanks Red Robin, yummmm.

We were pretty disappointed in this Red Robin. After being overseas for three years, I was really looking forward to RR again. We were seated pretty quickly which wasn't surprising because we got there pretty late for dinner - maybe 8:30? We ordered onion rings as an appetizer and a couple of burgers for our meals. When our burgers came, we asked about the onion rings and the waitress admitted that she forgot to put them in ... so we didn't get them. Both mine and my husband's food came out cold (the burgers and fries) but my burger was still really good ... of course a hot burger would have been better. It was my birthday, so my husband of course found our waitress somewhere and asked for them to sing to me. She totally forgot about it ... so when she brought the check he just asked her in front of me if they were still planning on singing. The service was TERRIBLE. I love RR food, but unfortunately had an awful experience at this one.

The burgers are pretty good, and the turkey burger is great. The service is not so great. The "greet staff" appears to change with each visit and generally has the IQ of a grape. Several times they have forgotten I was sitting there, awaiting a take-away order. Once I was so mad I stormed the kitchen and gave them an earfull - they immediately made amends by apologising profusely and giving me a free meal. I have been told by others to go to the bar & place your order there because you'll be talking to a grown up who has a sense of responsibility and an attention span of more than 2 minutes.

Last night, I ate here. The service and food was good.  The small two person table we were seated at was very narrow and in the path of alot of traffic.  My friend is taller, his elbow was barely sticking out and got it bumped by a server's tray as they were flew by.  Other than the seating issue it was a 2 to 3 star experience. I will be back for the food.

I could live on their steak fries...:-) service was friendly and efficient, but on a Saturday afternoon the noise level was worse than a Kiss concert on steroids.  (just wondering out loud: do parents of toddlers who scream non stop just tune them out, and if so, do they realize other people can't?) I mean, c'mon parents, this is a family atmosphere, but it's isn't freakin' Chuck E Cheese!!  We will take the advice written previously to sit in the bar next time. Apparently the day we were there it was everyone in the world's birthday, and the birthday clapping song was cute the first time....it gets old fast. My companion threatened to tell the server it was my birthday. (it wasn't) I threatened to decorate him with his malted.  End of discussion. My companion had the shrimp and cod, thumbs up on the shrimp, the cod not so much.  The breading was tasty but the fish itself was not. His malted was excellent, and seemingly neverending.  I had the Gourmet Cheeseburger, and the server asked if I wanted "no pink" or "a little pink" and it took me a moment to realize she was asking how I wanted it cooked.  I said a little pink.  Oops, I should have asked her to define "little"....not her fault, it was just a bit too rare for my taste.  My mistake, not hers.  Tip: ask for extra napkins, you're going to need them. Over all the food was great, it's a fun place, but next visit (and we will return as soon as our arteries unclog) we will sit in the bar and pray it is an off day for birthdays.
Had the Jim Beam burger and it was surprisingly good. They were very busy but the waitress was great, Food came quickly and she kept our drinks full.
Bland, run-of-the-mill corporate food. On top of that, my spouse and I have mad stomach issues three hours after dinner. Yuck. Stay home and cook.

I have always enjoyed the food here, I primarily eat the salads and drink water but the booth spaces are too narrow. If you are more than a petite size woman with breasts, you will not fit comfortably in a booth. They are too narrow and tight. Is it really so important to cram people in and leave no room for comfort? Sheesh!

Good food but just way to LOUD! That is why, we have only went once in the 6 years that we have lived here. So, just because I love onion rings, and people keep saying go to Red Robin, no way, to LOUD, for me.

A curse on you, Red Robin Silverdale, for going corporate and destroying what was the best happy hour in all of Kitsap county. Anyway, if you want to eat here, and you don't have any little cherubs with you, sit in the bar.  There probably won't be a wait (especially since there's no happy hour anymore), and your dinner conversation won't be interrupted by the birthday celebrations that always seem to be going on at this restaurant.
I'm impressed and always will be with Red Robin, Although 1 experience could have been better but it improved. awesome Employees and Customer Service and the food is excellent.

I have been to many Red Robins all over the country and had no problems. But I have been to this one 3 times and have gotten sick every time. And every time my drink remained empty all night I had to ask for a refill and the waiter never brought me one but I saw him filing other's drinks all night. My food tasted okay but it was very salty and greasy. I will not be going back to this particular Red Robin again.

I've worked at Red Robin and it's different to see how it translates from what you know. The service was okay, the server was a bit stand-offish. The Spinach Dip at Red Robin is the best I've ever had, because it has the element of cream to it which makes it perfect. We sat down for some drinks and appetizers and that's what we got. I'll have to say the fact they managed to charge me for extra bread for my spinach dip is kind of dumb. I'm not cheap, but they have never done it before and the server was weirdly rude about such a concept when it should have been the other way around.
The burgers are excellent and are cooked to order, service is friendly and they cater to family. Food is always hot and bountiful

1/17/2012 i received a call from general manager at red robin concerning my original comments today. he spent more time telling me about the many improvements, mainly timely delivery of food than why i didn't like the food and service. who cares if the food is delivered quickly if it tastes like garbage??? i see another vacant restaurant in silverdale soon!!!!!!!

Yawn... It's Red Robin. The only reason to go there is if your with a group of friends and you want something that everyone can sorta agree on that serves alcohol in the area. Other than that what's the point? It's crowded. Loud. The waits can be really long unless you sit in the bar area. The food is only ok at best. Nothing I would rave about to anyone. Speciality drinks are so sweet they hurt. Burgers are alright to decent but don't even come close to other options in the area. The score is saved by bottomless fries and excellent service. The people working there are kind attentive and I've even gotten a few free beers there, but with that said the noise and crowd make for more of a headache than dining experience.

We love the bottomless fries and strawberry lemonade!  The burgers are the best in town, and we also like the French Onion soup and Chicken Caesar wrap.  The place is often packed, but we usually don't have to wait too long for a table.  The service is good, and the prices are affordable.

Love the Fish and Chips mainly due to them having the best tartar sauce anywhere. Prices can run a little bit ridiculous and the noisy obnoxious atmosphere makes it difficult to bring my kids here. If the service was better and they still had their happy hour I'd give them a higher score but once you have received your food they tend to forget about your "bottomless soda".

I have been traveling for the last 30 days.  On the road, I ate at another chain and waited 10 minutes to get a fork for my salad and never did the wait person to check on me.   When I got home, I really wanted a good burger which is one of my favorite food groups as you have carbs, protein and veggies.   Anyway, the service at Silverdale Red Robin was outstanding.   I got there when they openned.  So, there were 2 talbes, but within 30 minutes she had 12 tables most with at least 4 people and one with 12 people.  She greeted everyone got there drinks and then took meal order. She was moving the whole time.  RR staff work together as a team to make sure everyone got their food while it was still hot and when the table of 12 had 4 things they still wanted.  The wait person moved swiftly to accomplish their guests desires.  It was amazing and awesome to watch.  RR staff  made sure that each table whether with one person or the twelve had everything they needed and enjoyed their meal. I am happy to be home, yes.  Also, gratedul for a good hamburger, fries and salad. I will be going here more often and buy gift cards for others from here.

generally the service is typically very good. by now most of the servers know my friends and i and we do have our favorite servers. i don't think we've had anything there that we didn't like. OH! and the spinach artichoke dip is wonderful. once i went there one day after a show and accidentally left my polaroids and cd there and came back the next day and Marshall, our waiter, remembered and got them for me before i even asked about it. he's one of the A+ servers there.

Good chewin' for the most part.  The tower o' onion rings is great, the drinks just keep on coming, and the burgers are tasty.  Bottomless steak fries is a great concept.  The only cons: it's hard to pay almost $10 per burger the first time you are there, but not so hard you won't come back and do it again; and the place is LOUD.  Not a place that you would generally go to to relax and unwind.

I went there last night with the fam.  OK.  Let me start by saying I've worked in restaurants for 17 years and even done corporate at Applebee's in college.  I have been to this location before and it has been okay and the norm for corporate.  It had been probably 2 years since we were there.  But last night was great.  The hostesses were on the ball and nice, our server Steph J. was really sweet.  The food was great.  This kids had the Whiskey Creek Chicken burger and raved.  I had the Chili Chili Burger.  It was darn tasty and huge but lemme tell you that when you order this burger it comes with Parmesan Garlic fries instead.  These were AMAZING!!!  Better than the Mariner's Safeco Fries!!  I scarfed them down and only had room for 2 bites of my burger.  I was so happy  that I took the kids' leftover fries and tried to recreate them at home (not so successful tho may I add).  Oh and I had a raspberry margarita that was pretty tasty especially when it was 82 outside but it was a little seedy.  I just wanna go back and have some fries lol!!!
